We define total cluster growth R as the number of new cases in V adjacent (connected by an edge) to any known case in V c, where
R ≤ | V |
. To resolve the event that a new vertex in V is adjacent to vertices in more than one cluster, we reduced the subset of edges between V and V c, maintaining only the edges with minimum weight per vertex in V. If more than one edge to a given vertex
u ∈ V
had exactly the same minimum weight, then we selected one edge at random.
